intro: Periploca chrysantha, commonly known as the golden periploca, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, reddish berries that contain toxic seeds, a feature common in its family. Periploca chrysantha is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to coastal environments.
